title: Highest Social Contributions
description: In 2023, South Korea had the highest social contributions in the world, amounting to 195,955,725,484,390 LCU.

title: Lowest Mortality from Major Diseases (Female)
description: In 2021, South Korea had one of the lowest mortality rates from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory diseases among females, at 4.3%.

title: Lowest Prevalence of Underweight in Female Children
description: In 2020, only 0.2% of female children under 5 in South Korea were underweight, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Lowest Prevalence of Stunting in Female Children
description: In 2020, South Korea had a very low prevalence of stunting among female children under 5, at just 0.9%.

title: Lowest Prevalence of Wasting in Male Children
description: In 2020, only 0.2% of male children under 5 in South Korea were affected by wasting, one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: Highest Suicide Rate Among Females
description: In 2021, South Korea had the highest female suicide mortality rate, with 16.94 per 100,000 female population.
